results.title: First break
results.creator_credit: Adrienne Amato, Derek Rogers, Silva Basmajian and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The ongoing struggle of living with a diagnosed mental illness is portrayed in this program through candid interviews over one year with three teenagers, who are experiencing mental illness, and their families. Their personal stories, shared with great sensitivity and honesty, illuminate the challenges and dis-orientating effects of mental illness as well as its impact on their conception of their self-identities and their relationships with family and friends. As the camera follows the course of their lives over this period we are given an insight into their own hopes, strengths and achievements as well as their frustrations in dealing with their mental illness in every day life. “First Break” also questions the stigmatised view of mental illness through these very personal stories, providing a portrait of young people coping with their experiences and the powerful changes it has meant for their own as well as their families lives.

results.title: First born = Premier-ne
results.creator_credit: Joan Henson, Colin Low, Susan Huycke and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film of poetic intent, set in Canada’s Pacific Rim National Park, where a woman giving birth, dreams of the growing infant. From the beauty of the images and the evocative music and sound effects, the viewers are impelled toward their own interpretation. Sound film without words.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Joan Henson, Colin Low, Susan Huycke and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Firelight = Clair-Obscure
results.creator_credit: Paul Bochner, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A highly personal and impressionistic piece of work, Firelight explores time. This animated film has long dissolves and pastel shades which reflect its ephemeral nature, its steady progression and the constancy of its cycles. It is a gentle film that sets the mind adrift. Film without words. Music by Eldon Rathburn.

results.title: Living with disaster: stories and experiences from disasters
results.brief_description: ‘Living with disaster’ is a major project by ACMI in collaboration with the Attorney General’s Department through its Emergency Management division and the CFA, in order to capture stories of young people who have survived natural disasters.

results.title: Fishermen
results.creator_credit: Guy L. Cote and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Should he choose to stay boss of his own boat and hope for better catches, or seek a job in commercial fishing, trading independence for a more certain income? This film is about the choice that faces many of Canada’s east-coast fishermen. (Awards: Berlin; Bloemfontein; Columbus)

results.title: Fisherman's fall
results.creator_credit: Robert Nichol, Peter Jones and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: One of Canada’s best known fly-fishermen, essayist Roderick Haig-Brown, demonstrates the art of salmon fishing in the Campbell River of northern Vancouver Island. The film, like the fisherman, has eyes for more than the river’s surface. The camera looks below, showing what the fish sees and the fisherman senses. A film of solitude and of harmony with nature. (Awards: Toronto; Detroit; Novi Sad)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Nichol, Peter Jones and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: First time afloat
results.creator_credit: Maurice Dybeck, Peter Halket and Explorer Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Canoecraft”.
Intended for the complete newcomer to canoeing, this films shows the importance of never canoeing without a lifejacket. Shows methods of getting afloat, simple paddling strokes, and how to choose a route. Also shows how easy it is to escape from a capsize, and deals with how to land both canoeist and canoe. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Basic strokes
results.creator_credit: Maurice Dybeck, Peter Halket and Explorer Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Canoecraft”.
Shot in both still and fast moving water, shows all the simple skills needed to paddle a canoe. Shows forward strokes, sculling draw, slap support, sculling for support, reverse paddle, sweep stroke, draw stroke, low telemark and hanging draw.

results.title: Fish and chips cooking library. - Volume 1.
results.brief_description: Simple recipes garnished with humour and a smattering of hints and tips are demonstrated by Peter Doyle of the Sydney restaurant family. He shows you everything you need to know about how to make delicious seafood meals, including how to cook a fish in your dishwasher. The video is accompanied by a recipe booklet which also includes charts which show you which fish to substitute for another, and when particular fish are in season. The video is also time coded so that you can find the recipe you want, quickly and easily.
